The following is my solution an MoP exercise.

I'm asking for feedback because the MoP exercise suggests I might use push_neg or by_cases:

You will need to use a tactic (such as push_neg or by_cases) which is capable of handling the subtler negations.

my solution to MoP 8.1 ex 12

example (f : X → Y) : Injective f ↔ ∀ x1 x2 : X, x1 ≠ x2 → f x1 ≠ f x2 := by
dsimp [Injective]
constructor
· --
intro h
intro x y
intro g
by_contra Z
have h2: f x = f y → x = y := by apply h
apply h2 at Z
contradiction
· --
intro h
intro x y
intro g
by_contra X
have h2: x ≠ y → f x ≠ f y := by apply h
apply h2 at X
contradiction

I don't appear to have any "subtle negations" - have I gone very wrong? Lean is not reporting any errors.
This looks fine, by_contra is handling the negations here
